bullets.text: U.S. CPI rose 2.7% y/y in November; shelter inflation remains a key driver, complicating the disinflation narrative.
Real average hourly earnings increased 0.8% y/y in November, indicating modest real wage gains despite still-elevated cumulative prices since 2020.
Japan’s CPI stayed above the BoJ’s 2% target for a 44th month, strengthening the case for additional tightening at upcoming policy meetings.
Federal Reserve issued a new staff supervision manual for the largest, most complex banks, signaling tighter, more standardized oversight expectations.
TikTok signed agreements toward a U.S. joint venture/ownership restructuring, reducing near-term ban risk but raising governance and China-approval uncertainty.
Trump signed an executive order to reclassify cannabis, reshaping regulatory and tax assumptions; sector volatility reflects uncertainty over implementation details.
Micron reported surging AI-memory demand and capacity constraints (“more than sold out”), reinforcing the thesis of persistent HBM/DRAM tightness supporting prices.
Nike warned its turnaround remains midstream as China sales plunge and tariffs pressure margins, highlighting consumer-demand and trade-policy sensitivity for global brands.
Ukraine urged E.U. leaders to deploy frozen Russian funds for defense; Hungary’s Orbán called such plans a dead end, underscoring intra-EU fracture risk.
Trump Media agreed to merge with fusion firm TAE in a ~$6B deal, blending political-media capital with speculative energy tech financing risk.
Scientists identified a hidden T-cell “switch” that could broaden cancer immunotherapy effectiveness, potentially expanding treatable patient populations and therapeutic targets.
Researchers demonstrated an “impossible” Earth-to-space quantum link is feasible, advancing prospects for secure satellite-based quantum communications networks.
Beginning January 2026, all ACM publications become open access, shifting computer-science publishing economics toward author/institution funding and broader global knowledge diffusion.
